IntApp will be at LegalTech 2008 from February 5th through the 7th. This is the 27th annual IT conference produced by ALM. IntApp will be exhibiting in booth #110 on the trade show floor in the Elite hall and staff will be on hand to interact with customers, prospective customers and partners.

2007 National Law Journal 250 Released
The results of the 2007 NLJ 250, the National Law Journal's 30th annual survey of the nation's largest law firms, were recently published. At present, IntApp counts 30% of the list as clients, including 50% of the top 20. We were also proud to play an important role in most of the major NLJ 250 firm mergers in 2007.
Further details about rankings and industry trends can be found at: law.com.
NLJ 250
Announcing Wall Builder 3.2
IntApp is excited to announce the availability of Wall Builder v3.2. With this release, IntApp makes available a new add-on module - Attorney Acknowledgment Tracking - that enables law firms to proactively manage compliance of confidentiality screens. This module allows the Wall Builder administrator to:
Request acknowledgment of specific screens through an e-mail-based notification workflow
Determine specific attorneys who have not acknowledged a confidentiality screen
Report on pending acknowledgments across the firm
Please contact your Account Manager for more details on the Wall Builder release and add-on module.
Announcing Time Builder 2.1
We’re pleased to announce the latest update to Time Builder, our time capture solution. Time Builder helps firms increase billings, accelerate attorney time entry, and streamline pre-bill and collection processes. It enables attorneys to catch time that might otherwise go unbilled by creating an automated journal or “daily diary” of their activity. Version 2.1 provides several important new features, including:
Expanded native phone support to leading PBX and VoIP systems
Context-sensitive help system
Extensive UI and usability enhancements
Announcing Integration Builder 4.1
IntApp is excited to announce the release of Integration Builder v4.1 this quarter. Among a host of improvements and enhancements, this release also features:
The ability to create and modify permissions on Windows file shares
The ability to report against any data handled by IntApp integrations
Enhancements to the web services interface and processing performance
The upgrade is available to all Series 4 customers as part of software maintenance and will be made available as a download and install through Relationship Builder. Full release notes will be distributed in advance through the IntApp Integration Builder Technical Mailing Lists and also posted to the IntApp Resource Center.
New IntApp Team Members
Warren Knowles has joined our team as a Senior Solution Engineer. Prior to IntApp, Warren served as Practice Manager for Open Text's Legal Global Services division, where he supervised the Managing Consultants group which is responsible for the planning and implementation of all LegalKEY Conflicts, Records, Docketing and New Business Intake projects. In addition to LegalKEY, Knowles consulted firms on implementing and customizing Open Text's Business Intelligence product.
Before Open Text, Knowles spent 8 years as Technology Implementation Manager at the law firm Zelle, Hofmann, Voelbel, Mason & Gette LLP, a national complex litigation firm. He was responsible for the planning and implementation of all the firm's technology focused projects. Additionally, Knowles provided technical guidance for many of the firm's high profile cases and trials.
Paul Zengilowski has joined our business development team. Prior to IntApp, Paul was with DataCert since 2002. After leading DataCert’s North American sales efforts for two years, he shifted his focus in 2006 to defining product direction and strategies as director of product marketing and most recently was Associate General Manager with responsibility for the development and overall growth of DataCert’s business and services within the corporate legal community.
Paul has been actively engaged in selling, implementing and supporting electronic commerce solutions to Fortune 500 corporations and large privately-held companies since 1995, when he co-founded DATA Clearinghouse Corporation, a company which provided an e-commerce and collaborative workflow application for Fortune 500 companies and their outside counsel. He also has extensive experience in e-commerce in the healthcare market. Paul holds a bachelor of arts from Harvard University.
Chris Erikstrup joined IntApp recently as the Midwest Regional Sales Manager. Chris has deep experience with content management systems coming from the EMC/Documentum group. He was responsible for leading sales which focused on meeting compliance focused solutions - including eDiscovery, Records Management and business continuity. His work with Fortune 50 firms looking for solutions to manage confidentiality will benefit IntApp customers.
Chris has been working with customers across the Midwest for the past 10 years as they seek to leverage technology to improve processes while driving down costs from IT. His ability to partner with the business side of the firm, coupled with his deep experience with technology, will help firms as they seek ways to optimize their workflow while minimizing risk. Chris has an MBA from the University of St. Thomas (Minneapolis, MN).
Debbie Hineman has joined IntApp as the Southern Regional Sales Manager. With over 20 years of experience in the software industry, she most recently worked in the training sector representing Learn.com, the leader in on-demand workforce productivity software and employee performance development systems. While at Learn.com, Debbie worked with companies with a defined requirement to train, track and report on employees due to HIPPA, SOX or other Government regulations. In addition, Debbie worked with her customers to define other areas where they could improve their training departments.
She previously worked for Citrix Systems, a global leader in application serving software and services, where she was responsible for identifying and developing new business in the Southern territory. Debbie, a graduate from Texas State University, resides in Texas.
